headline: Blackened Chicken
description: Blackened chicken is a Cajun favorite, and this recipe is so easy. A homemade blackening rub comes together in seconds, and the chicken sears in minutes.

video.description: See how to make a spicy, Cajun-style blackened chicken.
video.name: Blackened Chicken

name: Blackened Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over high heat until it is smoking hot, about 5 minutes.

While the skillet is heating, mix together paprika, cayenne, cumin, thyme, onion powder, white pepper, and salt in a small bowl. Spray chicken breasts on both sides with cooking spray, then coat evenly with spice mixture.
Place chicken in the hot pan and cook for 1 minute. Turn, and cook 1 minute on other side. Transfer chicken to the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious! Made this to replicate a salad from Roti Restaurant to add to a salad and was in awe! Yum!!
We all just loved this recipe!! Cooked it for almost 15 mins in the oven and it was so moist!!! Did have to make the spices 3 times and dusted both sides!!! delish
I doubled all the spices except the Cayenne, which I tripled. I also cut into equally sized strips and fried them up in a pan. This was super simple to make, and delicious!
Massively spicey, next time I will pan fry a little longer. But overall pretty good
Absolutely delicious. Going on my favorites list.

Loved the seasoning...... followed the directions and watched the video..... House was WAY TOO Smokey..... will never do it again in the house, but will try it on the grill..... fantastic taste ( after the smoke cleared)
Didn't taste much like blackened chicken but it was tasty and pretty simple. The breasts I had were probably too thick so I had to bake longer but it was still juicy

This recipe is a winner!! I have made it multiple times and different ways - grill, cast iron to a baking sheet, and it's always great, but it came out the absolute best when I bought thin sliced chicken breasts and kept them in the cast iron skillet on the stove top. Took about 5 mins on each side, with a very hot skillet on med heat. I also used cooking spray, instead of oil, to cut down on smoke as the top comment on this recipe advises. My spouse has an undying hatred of cumin, do not ask me why, so I substitute garlic powder. Perfection!
So quick easy and delicious!
Thumbs up! Very moist and juicy. The only thing I'd add to the ingredients is salt.

I followed the instructions exactly and only made one chicken breast (boneless and skinless) and it was not especially thick. The instructions say after it's blackened to put it in the preheated oven for 5 minutes. It was still RAW inside. I ended up baking it for 15-20 min, checking for the internal temperature. This was disappointing, because the rest of my dinner had to keep reheating to wait for the chicken.

It did taste great though.
I've made this twice. The 2nd time I used half the cyanne pepper and twice the salt. Turns out restaurant quality. Amazing recipe!
This is my second time making this. The seasoning is good, but it takes more than the supposed 5 minutes to bake. It usually needs 10-15 minutes for me.

I wasn't a big fan of this but I probably didn't do something right. It definitely didn't just take 5 minutes in the oven after searing it on the stove in the skillet. I'd try and tweak it if I made it again because I love blackened chicken.
Easy, fast delicious!!
I made a larger portion of the rub and keep it for when i need it. Its great on fish as well.
It was great! I just thought that it didn't go far enough once the spices were mixed. Easy fix for next time tho
This recipe is fantastic! We used Italian seasoning instead of tyme because we didn't have any and we use olive oil for a healthier take!

Super delicious! I added garlic powder, adobo seasoning, and just used regular black pepper, and it was incredibly flavorful! Not spicy at all, just very tasty and moist. I just cooked them on the stovetop rather than turning on the oven, because who wants to heat up their home during the summertime? This would be fabulous grilled, too. I served it with a garlicky brown rice and a side salad. Definitely going to make a big batch of it to have on hand! 10/10
Great recipe! It could use a bit more seasoning on the chicken though, but it was still very tasty! I cooked the chicken on the grill and it tasted wonderful! Just make sure to keep an eye on it.

The spices are nicely done, but the cooking times are way off. Even with my pan hot and my stove top up to max heat it takes more than 1 min on each side to have actual blackening of the chicken. And 5 mins in the oven is definitely not enough to cook all the way through.

Really good! I added a mayo base sauce and it was awesome. I will be adding this method of 
cooking chicken to my arsenal.
family liked it
I prepared it as written and it turned out fabulous.
Baked 17 minutes & was perfect! Sliced into juicy strips and served on a bed of homemade Rotini Alfredo with fresh steamed broccoli and/or sauted spinach

SO GOOD! This was my first time making chicken! I am a broke college student that is on a budget so any food I come across with "reusable ingredients", I go with it! I spent about $15 on the spices TOTAL. I buy once and can use them for 2 years. The chicken wasn't spicy but definitely had some spice to it. Very amazing. I cooked for 2 of my friends and they loved it too. Highly recommend!!
I followed the recipe as written, except I used leg quarters instead of chicken breasts. I also didn't have any cumin, but the hubby and the son loved the end results.
There was not enough seasoning if you are using larger breasts. May be too spicy for some. My family loved it!!! Made it with grilled corn and rice.
I make up a huge batch of the seasoning and use it on other meats as well!
Used thin cut chicken breasts. Omit salt and thyme, used Cajun seasoning instead. Added 1/4 tsp garlic powder. Seared in cast iron pan longer and in oven just to keep warm.

This was my first attempt and it was pretty good. Unfortunately I was missing some of the spices, and had to make to do. 

Can't wait to try this again!!

I doubled the spice amounts, which really worked out perfectly. I had regular sized chicken breast halves, which are somewhat thick in spots, so it took much longer than 5 minutes in the oven. Perhaps 5 minutes would work if the breasts were pounded out thin. It ended up being delicious!

Great combo of spices with a little heat. I don't like white pepper, so I substituted that with smokehouse black pepper. I also grilled it instead of the recommended directions. Delicious! I've since filled a shaker with it to have on hand.

i added an fried onions on it 
and yes i'll make it again
Cooked it in the cast iron skillet on the bbq. Delicious
We liked but I doubled the seasonings and did both sides of the chicken
It's so tender and lovely and easy to do, amazing with some of the other vegetable side dishes on here or with rice. Give it a go!
It was OK. Nothing really special.
I added garlic powder and smoked paprika....my guests loved it!!!
Delicious

Turned out really good. Spicy enough to know it is blackened chicken but not so much that it couldn’t be enjoyed. Everyone liked it and we’ve added this to our favorites. Adjusted the oven time to about 30 minutes as the breasts were fairly large but that was the only change made.
I've actually made it twice. It is very good. And easy! I will continue to make it. I like the combination of spices, so I did not make any changes.
Cooked in oven for 15 minutes.
Loved how simple and tasty this meal was...if there was one change would be to lessen the black pepper a bit.
This is a great recipe! perfect mix of spices!!!

Excellent recipe and directions. Juicy inside and visually pleasant outside. 
It came out to be a much easier way to cook for the week. Sliced for snacks, as an entree or sliced to use in a sandwich instead of cold cuts, cut into cubes for a salad or with pasta.

This is great. Also it totally fits in with the weight watchers diet. Next time I will flatten the chicken breasts before putting the spices on...I did double the spice. Will definitely make it again.

This was so good! I didn't have onion powder, so I used garlic salt and skipped the table salt. I also made double the spice. As others mentioned, it took much longer than 5 minutes in the oven. But they came out juicy and spicy. Delicious!
I didn't, and won't, change a thing. I'll double it though - I want it on both sides generously. I'll be making a container full and taking it to the lake this summer. Thanks so much for this recipe!

Full disclosure: I didn't measure any quantities of my spices- I eyeballed it. I just used this mix and chicken preparation. I overdid it with the cayenne pepper but otherwise this chicken was DELICIOUS! Already planning to adjust and make it again. Tender, juicy and flavorful. Would go great on its own with a side, or in a salad.
Chicken took a little longer in the oven but came out very tasty and juicy which was difficult for me before with the chicken breast.
This was delicious!! Served it with brown rice/quinoa medley along with some roasted brussel sprouts! Will definitely be making again

This was a very easy recipe to,follow I followed he recipe but I coated the chicken and let set in fridge for a few hours, my husband loved it and it was great as leftovers the next day, I served with finger potatoes with a dill and mustard sauce marinate and green beans
i cooked it as recipe stated and chicken was very raw still.

The chicken was good, but I think some oil needs to be added to the cast iron. I added a little bit, but it caused so much smoke all smoke detectors went off. This recipe does not call for oil, which I feel is a problem. I will try to make again but maybe use the grill instead to get the chicken crispy.
This was great. Sadly, I had to not use as much cayenne pepper since my son and wife can’t handle the heat.

This was great! I would recommend at least quadrupling the spice recipe so you have plenty! I did what another reviewer suggested and put the pan right from the stove to the oven to save on washing a dish. Thanks!
Turned out great. I baked this for at least 20 minutes and it was juicy and everyone liked this. It had a little spicy taste but definitely not hot. It was tasty. I will make this again.

Made this recipe with swordfish instead of chicken. The fish was tender and juicy inside and the outside flavor was delicious. We cut the cayenne in half since my family doesn’t like really like spicy food. Also I made a side sauce that combined sour cream with a small amount of sriracha and cumin.
Fabulous recipe! Easy, quick, and delicious! Cold leftovers almost taste like charcoaled!

This was very good and easy to make. You can dress it up with side dishes for company, or keep it simple for a week day meal.
To be clear: Nowhere does it say to put the oil directly in the pan. The oil goes directly on the chicken before the spices.

Other than quadrupling the recipe, we made it as written and everyone (including my teenagers) loved it. It did take longer than 5 mins in the oven, more like 15-20 and I cut my breasts in half so they are thin. We served it over fettuccine alfredo. We all thought it had the perfect heat. Great recipe. Easy to make. Thanks for sharing.
Great! Has a nice spicy kick to it. Now sure how much this changed the flavor, but I just cooked the chicken on the stovetop the whole way through. Served it with yellow rice, it made a good combo.
I made this recipe, and it was absolutely delicious. It was the blackening spice mix I was looking for.
Super yummy, quick & easy!

Super fantastic flavor. I followed others suggestions about doubling the spices, really wouldn't be shy with adding more! Also, instead of using two larger chicken breasts, I used 4 smaller sized ones. Seared in the pan for about 3-4 mins each side, then baked in the oven for about 10-12 minutes. The chicken came out super juicy and flavorful. Perfect to slice and put on top of my Gorgonzola cream sauce gnocchi.

This is a quick recipe to make and it's very tasty and easy. Keep this recipe handy for a day when you don't think you have time to cook. It's also calorie friendly. It would also make a good sandwich..... Great recipe!
Made this and it was great and chicken was very moist with the outside nice and blacked.
very yummy. didn't blacken very well but tasted great. Put the chicken on a Cesar salad

This was my first time cooking blackened chicken. I left out the onion only because my husband is allergic to onions. I also cut the breasts in half and pounded them. Then I dredged them in melted butter. Then I rubbed in the spices. I cooked them in the very hot cast iron pan for three minutes on each side. I served them over salad. They were very tender! The spices were great!
Excellent recipe, I did not have Thyme so I substituted Poultry seasoning in its place, I could not tell the difference. My friends who I served this too all asked for the recipe.

First time cooking a chicken breast and it was delicious! My husband loved the cajun taste from the paprika and cayenne pepper. I added garlic powder to this seasoning mix for a little extra flavor. 

My chicken breasts are a little more on the thicker side so I had to cook mine for a total of 15 minutes. 

Paired great on top of caesar salad!

I love to cook though I kinda suck at it. I found this recipe spicy enough for most. The only thing I altered is I used oregano instead of thyme because that's all I had on the spice thing. As far as the 1 review of a "dangerous fire", for one you typically don't cover cast iron, and for two you had it too hot. Mine turned out perfect but the cooking time always doesn't work out quite right. I cook way longer that the times stated. Overall really enjoyed it! My only question, after its seared in a cast iron pan, why not just put the hot pan in the pre-heated over? Again, I'm far from a chef but just wondering if it would turn out the same.....
I will definitely make this again BUT...5 minutes in the oven wasn't nearly enough time. If you butterfly the breasts maybe this would be enough time but 15-20 minutes if not butterflied.
I had a creole butter when it was finished
Delicious seasoning!
I will definitely make this again!
Yummy. My husband said it was like Chick-fil-A's spicy sandwich. Thanks.
Great dish and easy to make! Can be paired with anything.
very good! The seasonings are quite spicy but paired nicely with steamed broccoli and Peanut Butter noodles (from all recipes). Well done!
Just a clarification... the breast halves required much more than 5 minutes to cook. Suggest breast quarters cut quite thin. Allows spices to taste more and will cook faster.

I only used this recipie for the spices on top of the chicken. I didnt cook it as suggested. I cooked it in the oven in a glass pan only. At 350 for probably 30 minutes. I added a small bit of butter to the pan for moisture.
I found that the best thing to serve with this is Zatarans yellow rice and I add a can of pineapple tidbits in with the rice. The sweet balances out the spices with the chicken.Wonderful!

I doubled the seasoning ingredients and cut my 2 chicken breasts into 3 slices since I had 3 folks to feed. I followed the advice of another reviewer and just cooked these on a really hot skillet. They came out great. Very moist and a little spicy since I double the seasoning. You really need to serve these over something more bland like rice or Alfredo fettuccine noodles since the chicken is so flavorful. If you don't like it too spicy, just leave the recipe as is and I'm sure you'll enjoy it.

Hubby has asked me to make this again 4 times since last night.

Read other reviews, cut down on thyme and added garlic powder. 

Just cooked on cast iron on stove, no need to put in oven.
Sorry, didn't care for this. This did not taste like anything I have ever had blackened. No flavors penetrated the chicken at all. Thanks for sharing though,
I have not made this yet. I came in here looking for a blackened chicken recipe I could adjust to be low calorie and this one already is!
Love this recipe. Perfectly flavors, tender juicy chicken every time!
Great flavor but had to cook it much longer than the recipe called for.

So perfectly seasoned !! This will be my new go to. And I love that you only need one dish. I just popped the cast iron right in the oven. I served it over fettuccini. My whole household loved this one . The only change I made was adding some Cajun seasoning for a little more heat. Update i didn't notice the recipe said 5 minutes in to oven. That isn't nearly enough time : ( 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes is more reasonable
I made this on a George Foreman grill and it turned out great! I paired it with roasted zucchini and onions over a salad. It was a big hit with my husband too. Great summer meal!

This chicken was fantastic! It was definitely spicy. If you don't like heat you may want to tone down on some of the spices. I will be making this again and again.
Update 7/18/17 Made this for my SIL for a birthday dinner. She loved it. I serve it over Fettuccine Alfredo and it cuts the heat of it a little. Such a great easy recipe!
I found that sprinkling the seasoning on rather than rolling the chicken in it worked better, and used spray on cooking oil and tenderized the chicken breasts. Also made it on a hot grill instead.
After making this recipe, I tripled the spices and now use this as my blackening seasoning for everything! Love it!

This blackened chicken recipe was DELICIOUS !!! My somewhat picky husband LOVED the taste of this recipe and has asked me to make it again this week !!!! I followed the directions exactly as Karena had laid out (including brushing the chicken breasts with vegetable oil before sprinkling the seasoning on them), and it turned out PERFECTLY !!! I did throw in a teaspoon of garlic powder just for add'l flavoring. I doubled the recipe (based on previous reviews) and it was PERFECT for two large chicken breasts !!! Also, I seared the chicken breasts in a fry pan for approx 2 1/2 minutes per side before putting them on a tray in the oven for 20 minutes. (And allowed them to cool for approx 5 minutes after pulling them out of the oven.) Thanks Karena !! I will make this dish a "regular" in our home, and highly recommend to others !!! : )

Tastes like blackened chicken! Followed recipe practically as is, except left chicken in pan on stove instead of transferring to the oven. Turned out perfect, tender on the inside, and full of crisp flavor on the outside. Quick & healthy. Oh, I doubled the seasoning blend and used all of it. I will make a large amount of this seasoning blend to have on hand.
Great ????

Followed the recipe as written for the great tasting chicken. i also chopped up a green bell pepper, onion and 2 roma tomatoes. i used the same rub with a little olive oil on the chopped veggies and cooked them in the same iron skillet used for blacking the chicken. Warmed up 4 corn tortillas (placed them on top of the cooking veggies). Then placed all on warmed plates for an outstanding meal for two.
